purpleculture_pinyin:
yù
(archaic) to give birth to a child; to rear
(архаично) родить ребенка; чтобы вырастить
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 母 indicates the sound; 母 (mother) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
钟灵毓秀 [ zhōng líng yù xiù ]: A favorable ambience nurtures talent. (idiom)
毓婷 [ yù tíng ]: levonorgestrel tablet (contraception)
孙毓棠 [ sūn yù táng ]: Sun Yutang (1911-1985), historian and poet, studied in Tokyo, Oxford and Harvard

Ru_trainchinese: yù: (графема) (книжн.) рожать, вскармливать, воспитывать
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions from the " female " to the child, the " female " or the " human " shape, the " zi " shape or not inverted, but the " zi " shape must be below the " female " shape, which means childbirth, count next to the " zi " The small point is like amniotic fluid, which originally means fertility, which is a variant of the word "育". Or omit the human figure, just count the points from the child (amniotic fluid). Or add " Yuan " next to a female elephant giving birth, swaddling it in her hand. The chieftain of the matrilineal clan is the first grandmother of the family. Because of the merits of gestating offspring, it is called Yuzun. Later generations will continue to use this title and call the emperor Yu Yu. The classics are all written (Guo Moruo, Xu Zhongshu). Wang Guowei believes that the words " Yu ", "后" and "后" can be used as reference. Because the dead son is behind the people, it is extended to the first and last.

The oracle bone inscription is pronounced " after ", which means the ruler of the emperor, and is the title of the first king of Yin Xiangong. It is also used as a distinguishing word for temple names. The inscription on the wall means parenting. The wall plate: "Children of Yu", which is also read as the queen, is the name of the Shangwang Temple. The name of Yuqi Dingmao: "Use Zha Yuqi (ancestor) Dingzun", referring to the grandfather Wending of Emperor Xin (wang Wang) (See Du Linsong).

" Yu " is " educating " the Chinese word, "said the text": "sterile, adopted son make for good also" Yu Shu "said meat from 𠫓 sound:... Education sub-Yu, infertility or from 𣫭"
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle " Yu " will women have children in Italy, the number of small points like amniotic fluid, the original meaning of fertility, is " fertile " in Chinese.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「女」從倒子，「女」或作「人」形，「子」形或不倒轉，但「子」形必在「女」形下面，表示產子，「子」旁數小點象羊水，本義是生育，是「育」字的異體字。或省去人形，只從倒子從數點(羊水)。或加「袁」旁，象女子生育，以手持衣物襁褓接之。母系氏族之酋長是一族之始祖母，因為孕育子孫有功，故以毓尊稱之，後世沿用此尊號，稱君長為毓，典籍皆作后(郭沫若、徐中舒)。王國維認為「毓」、「后」、「後」本一字，可作參考。因倒子位於人後，故引申為先後之後。

　　甲骨文讀作「后」，表示君長，是殷先公先王的稱號。又用作先後之後，為廟號區別字。金文表示養育，牆盤：「毓子孫」，又通讀為後，是商王廟號，毓且丁卣：「用乍毓且(祖)丁尊」，指帝辛(紂王)之祖父文丁(參杜迺松)。

　　「毓」是「育」字的異體，《說文》：「育，養子使作善也。从𠫓肉聲。《虞書》曰：教育子。毓，育或从𣫭。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文「毓」會女人生孩子之意，數小點象羊水，本義是生育，是「育」的異體。

甲骨文從「 女 」從倒子，「 女 」或作「 人 」形，「 子 」形或不倒轉，但「 子 」形必在「 女 」形下面，表示產子，「 子 」旁數小點象羊水，本義是生育，是「 育 」字的異體字。或省去人形，只從倒子從數點(羊水)。或加「 袁 」旁，象女子生育，以手持衣物襁褓接之。母系氏族之酋長是一族之始祖母，因為孕育子孫有功，故以毓尊稱之，後世沿用此尊號，稱君長為毓，典籍皆作后(郭沫若、徐中舒)。王國維認為「 毓 」、「 后 」、「 後 」本一字，可作參考。因倒子位於人後，故引申為先後之後。 甲骨文讀作「 后 」，表示君長，是殷先公先王的稱號。又用作先後之後，為廟號區別字。金文表示養育，牆盤：「毓子孫」，又通讀為後，是商王廟號，毓且丁卣：「用乍毓且(祖)丁尊」，指帝辛(紂王)之祖父文丁(參杜迺松)。 「 毓 」是「 育 」字的異體，《說文》：「育，養子使作善也。从𠫓肉聲。《虞書》曰：教育子。毓，育或从𣫭。」
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions from the " female" to the child, the " female" or the " human" shape, the " zi" shape or not inverted, but the " zi" shape must be below the " female" shape, which means childbirth, count next to the " zi" The small point is like amniotic fluid, which originally means fertility, which is a variant of the word " 育". Or omit the human figure, just count the points from the child (amniotic fluid). Or add " Yuan" next to a female elephant giving birth, swaddling it in her hand. The chieftain of the matrilineal clan is the first grandmother of the family. Because of the merits of gestating offspring, it is called Yuzun. Later generations will continue to use this title and call the emperor Yu Yu. The classics are all written (Guo Moruo, Xu Zhongshu). Wang Guowei believes that the words " Yu", " 后" and " 后" can be used as reference. Because the dead son is behind the people, it is extended to the first and last. The oracle bone inscription is pronounced " after", which means the ruler of the emperor, and is the title of the first king of Yin Xiangong. It is also used as a distinguishing word for temple names. The inscription on the wall means parenting. The wall plate: "Children of Yu", which is also read as the queen, is the name of the Shangwang Temple. The name of Yuqi Dingmao: "Use Zha Yuqi (ancestor) Dingzun", referring to the grandfather Wending of Emperor Xin (wang Wang) (See Du Linsong). " Yu" is " educating" the Chinese word, "said the text": "sterile, adopted son make for good also" Yu Shu "said meat from 𠫓 sound:... Education sub-Yu, infertility or from 𣫭"

毓字的基本解释

毓
yù
同“育”，多用于人名。
姓。

毓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yù］
［《廣韻》余六切，入屋，以。］
(1)繁殖；养育。
(2)孕育；产生。

毓字的康熙字典解释

【辰集下】【毋字部】　毓； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页590第06
【廣韻】【集韻】?余六切，音?。與育同。【說文】養子使作善也。一曰稚也。【周禮·天官·大宰】以九職任萬民，二曰田園毓草木。又【地官】以蕃鳥獸，以毓草木。【註】毓，古育字。【班固·東都賦】豐圃草以毓獸。【註】毓，同育。　又郁毓，盛多也。【左思·蜀都賦】密房郁毓被其阜。

毓字的源字形

毓字的起名意思

：指同“育”，表生育，养育。

[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Yu Liuqie, sound?. Same with Yu. 【Said Wen】Adopted sons make good things. One is also naive. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Da Zai】Ten Wanmin with nine posts, and the second is the idyllic and lush vegetation. Also 【Land Officials】Take wild birds and beasts and Yu grass and trees. 育、养育。
生养;养育。多用于人名。
